data.title: Good to try different kinds of food
data.text: I've eaten here a couple of times. The amount of food is generous, it's fresh and reasonably priced. They work hard to provide a good customer experience,

data.title: Great food
data.text: This was my first time having African food. I was impressed I didn't know what to expect when I stepped in the door. I ordered the kaykay it had chicken in the dish and was kind of sweet. It came with hot sauce that was delicious. For my drink I ordered the mango juice and that was great as well. For the money I think that it was responsibly priced. The workers were very nice and the restaurant was fairly clean. It seemed like the locals loved this place as well. Next time I go back I will be ordering the goat dish

data.title: Great food!
data.text: My friend and I went for dinner. It is both a carry out and an eat in place. The portions are sizeable. The food has a very bright and sunny flavor. She ordered the Kay Kay and I had the chicken suqaar. We tried the sambosa appetizer (amazing). We also tried the bur (bread). Super sweet. The drinks come with the meal and we ordered their special guava and mango juices. We decided we would go again. The owner is very helpful and friendly. It's clean. Clearly a local place and heavily visited by the locals too as there is a Middle Eastern market right next door.

data.title: Great food
data.text: The food was very good. Especially the rice and Mango juice.  We had the beef dish. The spice was on the side, so you can spice it to your own taste.  I can hardly wait to go back and try the chicken.

data.title: Just weird taste in food
data.text: I think it is some food that we are not used to and that's why it did not right for us, I am pretty sure that people that are used to that kind of food will love it maybe in the future we'll try it again

data.title: Well worth the stop.
data.text: We drove 2 hours to get to this restaurant and I am not lying when I say it is the best food I've ever eaten and well worth the drive. It was so flavorful, fresh and delicious. My fiancée ordered the Kay Kay which he enjoyed very much. i ordered the goat with rice and a mango smoothie. The goat was great. The rice had cinnamon and raisins which I normal don't like but I could get enough of it! The mango smoothie was unbelievably delicious.we also got two sambusas which we spicy but not overwhelmingly and so good I wanted to order more. I can not stop raving about this place. We will be coming here every time we are in the area and hope to become regulars. The staff was so friendly it was as if we were old friends seeing each other again. When we told them we drove two hours away they were so grateful to us for have taken the time to come see what the hype was about.

data.title: Great stuff!!!
data.text: The wife andI had lunch here,shared the platter for two: fantastic and more than enough food for 3 or 4,goat, chickeh, beef, vegis and rice along with a wonderful broth and mango juice. The food was not as spicy as other African food we have tried, but  there was a hot sauce served on the side,we told the owner we liked it hot and he brought was more sauce and told us " in Africa it is said that hot food is like medicine, makes you better" I will have to agree. A great find in minnesota.

data.title: Something out of the Ordinary
data.text:
This place is definitely worth a visit. Prices are very reasonable, with each lunch item priced at $10, which includes soup and rice or a salad.  This was my first time there, so it was point-at-the-menu-and-guess time. First came a bowl of broth soup, served with a banana "to cool the mouth."  (I'm skeptical of the reviewer who said the food wasn't spicy.  Apparently he didn't try the soup.  It is beyond what most Minnesotans will tolerate.)
Next came a goat meat stew that came on a huge platter.The plate was covered by a sponge-like pancake, and some colorful cooked onions graced one end of the platter.  On the other end, mostly under the pancake was a fresh, crispy lettuce salad with mild dressing.  I loved the spices, but I couldn't begin to eat it all.  My dining companion had the beef curry, which consisted of cubes of beef with a bit of bone still attached. I think it is made to be eaten with the fingers.  It  was a bit chewy. That dish came with delicately flavored rice.
We ordered mango juice, and we were brought a large pitcher of it to share.  It was absolutely delicious.
Contrary to another of the reviews, there is table service.  The server was polite and helpful, but I did have a little trouble understanding him. I see that as my problem, but be prepared to use your best listening skills.
This is not fine dining, this is an informal neighborhood café. The tables were not wiped between customers, which nobody seemed to mind.  
Note that the #1 ranking on TripAdvisor seems to be partially the result of a lot of first-time reviewers.  
I look forward to another visit.

data.title: Delicious meal
data.text: My first experience with the cuisine.  The staff was great, made recommendations.  What a great find. Will go back to try other dishes.

data.title: A treasure hidden in a strip mall
data.text:
Easy to find; small and clean.  Very friendly staff.  Order at the counter and then sit or have it to go.  Grab your soft drink or water from the fridge at the counter.

I had the soup and Kay Kay.

Soup was so tasty and rich.  Veggie and onion flavors with spices.  See photo.  Recommended.   

Kay Kay is a one of a kind dish that is only made here: chicken with peppers, onions, and strips of tortilla simmered in some wonderful flavors.  Served with a little cup of spicy goodness.  Banana on he side.  See photo.  Recommended.

data.title: A Must Try!
data.text: I ordered the Beef Sukar with Injera. First they delivered the tea which was hands down the best tea I've ever had. Then, the vegetable soup which is more of a broth, and filled with a million flavors and delectable. Then the Beef Curry which was enough food for two people, and was just like a dish I had while visiting Kenya. The taste was not only amazing but brought back a special memory of my trip. And the people who work there? Are SO kind and enthusiastic about what they are serving. I will definitely stop back every time I am in Burnsville if only for more of their amazing tea!

data.title: Great food! Wonderful experience!
data.text: I enjoyed the Kay Kay very much. Soup made from goat broth. Tasty. Great service. Friendly staff. Try the Somali tea. Highly recommended.

data.title: A Treat for the Senses
data.text: This is an absolutely wonderful way to experience authentic African and Ethiopian food!  The experience took me back to Africa and the varied dishes we experienced a few years back.  Do not miss an opportunity to visit Takawal.  The food is not spicy, is very tasty, and is prepared and served by some of the most hospitable people we have ever met.  This is such a treat for our area and well-worth the drive.

data.title: Best Somali/East African Food I Have Had In Years
data.text:
I love East African food. Ethiopian, Kenyan, Djiboutian--I love it all. When I heard that the Twin Cities metro area was host to a huge Somali diaspora, I knew there had to be some amazing food, and I found it in Tawakal.

The quality starts with the people. Yussuf, the owner, is one of the most friendly people you're likely to meet. He is able to put people at ease immediately, which is very helpful when dealing with food from an unfamiliar region (as was the case for my 60ish parents and for the 80ish couple I also saw come in for lunch). Even the cooks and busboys here will chat you up and are charming and gregarious; the Oklahoma v. Notre Dame game was scheduled to be on, and they happily changed the TV channel and discussed college football with us. You don't get that at most places.

So now, the heart of the matter--the food! We started with a vegetable soup which was fantastic. It contained cinnamon, coriander, and a curry base, with mashed potatoes for body. They then add chopped onions and carrots. I resorted to drinking it straight out of the bowl!

The chicken curry was straightforward and delicious. Nothing fussy about it--heaps of chicken with a fantastic sauce. It was mildly hot, but not such that my Okie father couldn't handle it. The accompanying rice was perfectly cooked and aromatic. I could happily eat that chicken curry every week and never grow tired of it.

The kay kay was a pleasant surprise. It was extremely delicious (and filling). It had loads of chicken and shredded japati, with an amazingly flavorful sauce. They finished it off on top with the mildest sprinkling of cheese which, oddly enough, really made the dish. You could easily share this between two people and be perfectly happy with your choice.

I didn't order it, but did see a few gentlemen sharing the Sport for 2 dish. It looked fantastic. Should I ever again fins myself within 100 miles of Burnsville, I'm coming back to get it.

Finally, we ordered a single sambusa and split it. It was clearly fried to order (not sitting under some heat lamp), and was piping hot and tender when it reached us. My mother, who scorns all things fried, loved it. Get one.

I genuinely hope that these folks open more locations. Specifically, I'm hoping they open one in Austin, TX, where I live (my parents regaled the owner with how great business opportunities are in Austin)! Try this place--it won't disappoint.

data.title: Great People & Great Food
data.text: A number of Somali friends recommended I try Tawakal, and I couldn't be more thankful for the recommendation.  Above and beyond the delicious food, which was well-prepared with generous servings and incredible flavor (You haven't had Sambusa until you've had Tawakal's), the thing that struck me most was the friendly and genuinely nice reception I received by the owner, Yussuf. At once positive, polite and professional, he took the time to make recommendations and make sure I knew what was available.  I watched him with an older couple, and he spent a few minutes explaining many of the menu items and ensuring that they had a pleasant experience.  Simple, yet clean and pleasant, surroundings. For lunch or casual dining, you can't go wrong here.

data.title: Great Experience!!
data.text: Visited Tawakal for the first time and had a great experience!!  The brother-sister owners were very friendly and helpful.    The sambusas were outstanding.  The sample platter was huge - it included fish,  chicken and beef.  The fish was a hit!!

data.title: Neighborhood gem!
data.text: Ditto to all the comments about the helpful and friendly staff.  Food selections were wonderful, flavorful and very generous.  If yo like curry, you'll LOVE this place!  On some selections you can probably share one meal and still take a box home for leftovers.  Color pictures on menu helps vizualize the meal and the actual dish looks just like, too , not like the airbrushed pictures you see in other venues.

data.title: Wonderful flavors
data.text: My husband and I tried this restaurant and found the food delicious, the service courteous and the waitstaff very willing to help us esplore the different dishes. The menu offers pictures so that also helped decide on our order. My first choice was to order goat but it was no longer available that evening-the waiter said that many days it is gone by lunch time as it is a popular item. We decided to have a chicken dish with noodles. The waiter brought soup and a pineapple drink along with sambusas. The sambusas, piping hot fried turnovers filled with a seasoned ground beef mixture, were divine! I could have made a meal of the soup and the sambusas-Both were fabulous. This restaurant is small and definitely offers an interesting experience as we watched many clients come and take out foods. Prices are very reasonable and main portions are large. It seemed that the most important part for the waitstaff was to authentically please us, the customers, as you experienced new flavors.

data.title: heaven!
data.text: their chai is pure HEAVEN. the "goat meat soup" was excellent (where was the goat meat? must have been in the broth or blended. either way, the flavor was just perfect, nice and spicy) i  would have been satisfied to just stop there with the soup and tea. however, i had ordered a tilapia entree, which when it arrived was almost daunting in its portion size, even for me. we all ended up taking some food home and had a great supper that night with leftovers heehee and nice memories of this comfortable down to earth little restaurant. oh, and before we left, the manager gave me a refill on the chai which put me over my caffeine limit i think but a little further still into chai heaven.

data.title: Well worth the adventure!
data.text: Mysterious blends of spices make these dishes tantalizing! The portions are generous, the staff is friendly and helpful, willing to answer questions. If you haven't tried ingera, you should. (It's also gluten-free, made from teff flour.) The goat soup is absolutely delectable!  Each lunch dish consisted of soup, beverage, and main dish - a nice variety.
